comments.creator: ben.r.xiao@gmail.com
comments.author: ben.r.xiao@gmail.com
comments.text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; rv:7.0a1) Gecko/20110601 Firefox/7.0a1
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; rv:7.0a1) Gecko/20110601 Firefox/7.0a1

The download progress bar in the Nightly builds look much brighter than its native Windows counterpart. Either the gradients are off, or it just has higher brightness/contrast. In any case, it looks way too bright and hurts the eyes.

I've uploaded screenshots so you can compare the brightness. The native progress bar looks much more pleasing.

Reproducible: Always

The download progress bar in the Nightly builds look much brighter than its native Windows counterpart. Either the gradients are off, or it just has higher brightness/contrast. In any case, it looks way too bright and hurts the eyes.

I've uploaded screenshots so you can compare the brightness. The native progress bar looks much more pleasing.

Reproducible: Always

comments.raw_text:
It's not only brighter. Firefox has also an ugly white strips at the top and the bottom of progress bar (probably it's not fitted properly).
This bug has more than 6 months and it's still not fixed... I thought it will be easy to fix...

comments.text: I think it's the clipping that's throwing the brightness off, in which case this will get fixed by bug 658885.
